24DEFINE_LAZY_LEAKY_OBJECT_GETTER(CodeRangeAddressHint, GetCodeRangeAddressHint)
25
26void FunctionInStaticBinaryForAddressHint() {}
27
28} // anonymous namespace
29
30Address CodeRangeAddressHint::GetAddressHint(size_t code_range_size,
31 size_t alignment) {
32 base::MutexGuard guard(&mutex_);
33
34 // Try to allocate code range in the preferred region where we can use
35 // short instructions for calling/jumping to embedded builtins.
36 base::AddressRegion preferred_region = Isolate::GetShortBuiltinsCallRegion();
37
38 Address result = 0;
39 auto it = recently_freed_.find(code_range_size);
40 // No recently freed region has been found, try to provide a hint for placing
41 // a code region.
42 if (it == recently_freed_.end() || it->second.empty()) {
43 if (V8_ENABLE_NEAR_CODE_RANGE_BOOL && !preferred_region.is_empty()) {
44 auto memory_ranges = base::OS::GetFreeMemoryRangesWithin(
45 preferred_region.begin(), preferred_region.end(), code_range_size,
46 alignment);
47 if (!memory_ranges.empty()) {
48 result = memory_ranges.front().start;
49 CHECK(IsAligned(result, alignment));
50 return result;
51 }
52 // The empty memory_ranges means that GetFreeMemoryRangesWithin() API
53 // is not supported, so use the lowest address from the preferred region
54 // as a hint because it'll be at least as good as the fallback hint but
55 // with a higher chances to point to the free address space range.
56 return RoundUp(preferred_region.begin(), alignment);
57 }
58 return RoundUp(FUNCTION_ADDR(&FunctionInStaticBinaryForAddressHint),
59 alignment);
60 }
61
62 // Try to reuse near code range first.
63 if (V8_ENABLE_NEAR_CODE_RANGE_BOOL && !preferred_region.is_empty()) {
64 auto freed_regions_for_size = it->second;
65 for (auto it_freed = freed_regions_for_size.rbegin();
66 it_freed != freed_regions_for_size.rend(); ++it_freed) {
67 Address code_range_start = *it_freed;
68 if (preferred_region.contains(code_range_start, code_range_size)) {
69 CHECK(IsAligned(code_range_start, alignment));
70 freed_regions_for_size.erase((it_freed + 1).base());
71 return code_range_start;
72 }
73 }
74 }
75
76 result = it->second.back();
77 CHECK(IsAligned(result, alignment));
78 it->second.pop_back();
79 return result;
80}
81
82void CodeRangeAddressHint::NotifyFreedCodeRange(Address code_range_start,
83 size_t code_range_size) {
84 base::MutexGuard guard(&mutex_);
85 recently_freed_[code_range_size].push_back(code_range_start);
86}
87
88CodeRange::~CodeRange() { Free(); }
89
90// static
91size_t CodeRange::GetWritableReservedAreaSize() {
92 return kReservedCodeRangePages * MemoryAllocator::GetCommitPageSize();
93}
94
95#define TRACE(...) \
96 if (v8_flags.trace_code_range_allocation) PrintF(__VA_ARGS__)
97
98bool CodeRange::InitReservation(v8::PageAllocator* page_allocator,
99 size_t requested) {
100 DCHECK_NE(requested, 0);
101 if (V8_EXTERNAL_CODE_SPACE_BOOL) {
102 page_allocator = GetPlatformPageAllocator();
103 }
104
105 if (requested <= kMinimumCodeRangeSize) {
106 requested = kMinimumCodeRangeSize;
107 }
108
109 const size_t kPageSize = MutablePageMetadata::kPageSize;
110 CHECK(IsAligned(kPageSize, page_allocator->AllocatePageSize()));
111
112 // When V8_EXTERNAL_CODE_SPACE_BOOL is enabled the allocatable region must
113 // not cross the 4Gb boundary and thus the default compression scheme of
114 // truncating the InstructionStream pointers to 32-bits still works. It's
115 // achieved by specifying base_alignment parameter.
116 const size_t base_alignment = V8_EXTERNAL_CODE_SPACE_BOOL
117 ? base::bits::RoundUpToPowerOfTwo(requested)
118 : kPageSize;
119
120 DCHECK_IMPLIES(kPlatformRequiresCodeRange,
121 requested <= kMaximalCodeRangeSize);
122
123 VirtualMemoryCage::ReservationParams params;
124 params.page_allocator = page_allocator;
125 params.reservation_size = requested;
126 params.page_size = kPageSize;
127 if (v8_flags.jitless) {
128 params.permissions = PageAllocator::Permission::kNoAccess;
129 params.page_initialization_mode =
130 base::PageInitializationMode::kAllocatedPagesCanBeUninitialized;
131 params.page_freeing_mode = base::PageFreeingMode::kMakeInaccessible;
132 } else {
133 params.permissions = PageAllocator::Permission::kNoAccessWillJitLater;
134 params.page_initialization_mode =
135 base::PageInitializationMode::kRecommitOnly;
136 params.page_freeing_mode = base::PageFreeingMode::kDiscard;
137 }
138
139 const size_t allocate_page_size = page_allocator->AllocatePageSize();
140 // TODO(v8:11880): Use base_alignment here once ChromeOS issue is fixed.
141 Address the_hint =
142 GetCodeRangeAddressHint()->GetAddressHint(requested, allocate_page_size);
143 the_hint = RoundDown(the_hint, base_alignment);
144
145 constexpr size_t kRadiusInMB =
146 kMaxPCRelativeCodeRangeInMB > 1024 ? kMaxPCRelativeCodeRangeInMB : 4096;
147 auto preferred_region = GetPreferredRegion(kRadiusInMB, kPageSize);
148
149 TRACE("=== Preferred region: [%p, %p)\n",
150 reinterpret_cast<void*>(preferred_region.begin()),
151 reinterpret_cast<void*>(preferred_region.end()));
152
153 // For configurations with enabled pointer compression and shared external
154 // code range we can afford trying harder to allocate code range near .text
155 // section.
156 const bool kShouldTryHarder = V8_EXTERNAL_CODE_SPACE_BOOL &&
157 COMPRESS_POINTERS_IN_SHARED_CAGE_BOOL &&
158 v8_flags.better_code_range_allocation;
159
160 if (kShouldTryHarder) {
161 // Relax alignment requirement while trying to allocate code range inside
162 // preferred region.
163 params.base_alignment = kPageSize;
164
165 // TODO(v8:11880): consider using base::OS::GetFreeMemoryRangesWithin()
166 // to avoid attempts that's going to fail anyway.
167
168 VirtualMemoryCage candidate_cage;
169
170 // Try to allocate code range at the end of preferred region, by going
171 // towards the start in steps.
172 const int kAllocationTries = 16;
173 params.requested_start_hint =
174 RoundDown(preferred_region.end() - requested, kPageSize);
175 Address step =
176 RoundDown(preferred_region.size() / kAllocationTries, kPageSize);
177 for (int i = 0; i < kAllocationTries; i++) {
178 TRACE("=== Attempt #%d, hint=%p\n", i,
179 reinterpret_cast<void*>(params.requested_start_hint));
180 if (candidate_cage.InitReservation(params)) {
181 TRACE("=== Attempt #%d (%p): [%p, %p)\n", i,
182 reinterpret_cast<void*>(params.requested_start_hint),
183 reinterpret_cast<void*>(candidate_cage.region().begin()),
184 reinterpret_cast<void*>(candidate_cage.region().end()));
185 // Allocation succeeded, check if it's in the preferred range.
186 if (preferred_region.contains(candidate_cage.region())) break;
187 // This allocation is not the one we are searhing for.
188 candidate_cage.Free();
189 }
190 if (step == 0) break;
191 params.requested_start_hint -= step;
192 }
193 if (candidate_cage.IsReserved()) {
194 *static_cast<VirtualMemoryCage*>(this) = std::move(candidate_cage);
195 }
196 }
197 if (!IsReserved()) {
198 // Last resort, use whatever region we get.
199 params.base_alignment = base_alignment;
200 params.requested_start_hint = the_hint;
201 if (!VirtualMemoryCage::InitReservation(params)) return false;
202 TRACE("=== Fallback attempt, hint=%p: [%p, %p)\n",
203 reinterpret_cast<void*>(params.requested_start_hint),
204 reinterpret_cast<void*>(region().begin()),
205 reinterpret_cast<void*>(region().end()));
206 }
207
208 if (v8_flags.abort_on_far_code_range &&
209 !preferred_region.contains(region())) {
210 // We didn't manage to allocate the code range close enough.
211 FATAL("Failed to allocate code range close to the .text section");
212 }
213
214 // On some platforms, specifically Win64, we need to reserve some pages at
215 // the beginning of an executable space. See
216 // https://cs.chromium.org/chromium/src/components/crash/content/
217 // app/crashpad_win.cc?rcl=fd680447881449fba2edcf0589320e7253719212&l=204
218 // for details.
219 const size_t reserved_area = GetWritableReservedAreaSize();
220 if (reserved_area > 0) {
221 CHECK_LE(reserved_area, kPageSize);
222 // Exclude the reserved area from further allocations.
223 CHECK(page_allocator_->AllocatePagesAt(base(), kPageSize,
224 PageAllocator::kNoAccess));
225 // Commit required amount of writable memory.
226 if (!reservation()->SetPermissions(base(), reserved_area,
227 PageAllocator::kReadWrite)) {
228 return false;
229 }
230#if defined(V8_OS_WIN64)
231 if (win64_unwindinfo::CanRegisterUnwindInfoForNonABICompliantCodeRange()) {
232 win64_unwindinfo::RegisterNonABICompliantCodeRange(
233 reinterpret_cast<void*>(base()), size());
234 }
235#endif // V8_OS_WIN64
236 }
237
238// Don't pre-commit the code cage on Windows since it uses memory and it's not
239// required for recommit.
240#if !defined(V8_OS_WIN)
241 if (params.page_initialization_mode ==
242 base::PageInitializationMode::kRecommitOnly) {
243 void* base =
244 reinterpret_cast<void*>(page_allocator_->begin() + reserved_area);
245 size_t size = page_allocator_->size() - reserved_area;
246 if (ThreadIsolation::Enabled()) {
247 if (!ThreadIsolation::MakeExecutable(reinterpret_cast<Address>(base),
248 size)) {
249 return false;
250 }
251 } else if (!params.page_allocator->SetPermissions(
252 base, size, PageAllocator::kReadWriteExecute)) {
253 return false;
254 }
255 if (!params.page_allocator->DiscardSystemPages(base, size)) return false;
256 }
257#endif // !defined(V8_OS_WIN)
258
259 return true;
260}
261
262// Preferred region for the code range is an intersection of the following
263// regions:
264// a) [builtins - kMaxPCRelativeDistance, builtins + kMaxPCRelativeDistance)
265// b) [RoundDown(builtins, 4GB), RoundUp(builtins, 4GB)) in order to ensure
266// Requirement (a) is there to avoid remaping of embedded builtins into
267// the code for architectures where PC-relative jump/call distance is big
268// enough.
269// Requirement (b) is aiming at helping CPU branch predictors in general and
270// in case V8_EXTERNAL_CODE_SPACE is enabled it ensures that
271// ExternalCodeCompressionScheme works for all pointers in the code range.
272// static
273base::AddressRegion CodeRange::GetPreferredRegion(size_t radius_in_megabytes,
274 size_t allocate_page_size) {
275#ifdef V8_TARGET_ARCH_64_BIT
276 // Compute builtins location.
277 Address embedded_blob_code_start =
278 reinterpret_cast<Address>(Isolate::CurrentEmbeddedBlobCode());
279 Address embedded_blob_code_end;
280 if (embedded_blob_code_start == kNullAddress) {
281 // When there's no embedded blob use address of a function from the binary
282 // as an approximation.
283 embedded_blob_code_start =
284 FUNCTION_ADDR(&FunctionInStaticBinaryForAddressHint);
285 embedded_blob_code_end = embedded_blob_code_start + 1;
286 } else {
287 embedded_blob_code_end =
288 embedded_blob_code_start + Isolate::CurrentEmbeddedBlobCodeSize();
289 }
290
291 // Fulfil requirement (a).
292 constexpr size_t max_size = std::numeric_limits<size_t>::max();
293 size_t radius = radius_in_megabytes * MB;
294
295 Address region_start =
296 RoundUp(embedded_blob_code_end - radius, allocate_page_size);
297 if (region_start > embedded_blob_code_end) {
298 // |region_start| underflowed.
299 region_start = 0;
300 }
301 Address region_end =
302 RoundDown(embedded_blob_code_start + radius, allocate_page_size);
303 if (region_end < embedded_blob_code_start) {
304 // |region_end| overflowed.
305 region_end = RoundDown(max_size, allocate_page_size);
306 }
307
308 // Fulfil requirement (b).
309 constexpr size_t k4GB = size_t{4} * GB;
310 Address four_gb_cage_start = RoundDown(embedded_blob_code_start, k4GB);
311 Address four_gb_cage_end = four_gb_cage_start + k4GB;
312
313 region_start = std::max(region_start, four_gb_cage_start);
314 region_end = std::min(region_end, four_gb_cage_end);
315
316#ifdef V8_EXTERNAL_CODE_SPACE
317 // If ExternalCodeCompressionScheme ever changes then the requirements might
318 // need to be updated.
319 static_assert(k4GB <= kPtrComprCageReservationSize);
320 DCHECK_EQ(four_gb_cage_start,
321 ExternalCodeCompressionScheme::PrepareCageBaseAddress(
322 embedded_blob_code_start));
323#endif // V8_EXTERNAL_CODE_SPACE
324
325 return base::AddressRegion(region_start, region_end - region_start);
326#else
327 return {};
328#endif // V8_TARGET_ARCH_64_BIT
329}
330
331void CodeRange::Free() {
332 if (IsReserved()) {
333#if defined(V8_OS_WIN64)
334 if (win64_unwindinfo::CanRegisterUnwindInfoForNonABICompliantCodeRange()) {
335 win64_unwindinfo::UnregisterNonABICompliantCodeRange(
336 reinterpret_cast<void*>(base()));
337 }
338#endif // V8_OS_WIN64
339 GetCodeRangeAddressHint()->NotifyFreedCodeRange(
340 reservation()->region().begin(), reservation()->region().size());
341 VirtualMemoryCage::Free();
342 }
343}
344
345uint8_t* CodeRange::RemapEmbeddedBuiltins(Isolate* isolate,
346 const uint8_t* embedded_blob_code,
347 size_t embedded_blob_code_size) {
348 base::MutexGuard guard(&remap_embedded_builtins_mutex_);
349
350 // Remap embedded builtins into the end of the address range controlled by
351 // the BoundedPageAllocator.
352 const base::AddressRegion code_region(page_allocator()->begin(),
353 page_allocator()->size());
354 CHECK_NE(code_region.begin(), kNullAddress);
355 CHECK(!code_region.is_empty());
356
357 uint8_t* embedded_blob_code_copy =
358 embedded_blob_code_copy_.load(std::memory_order_acquire);
359 if (embedded_blob_code_copy) {
360 DCHECK(
361 code_region.contains(reinterpret_cast<Address>(embedded_blob_code_copy),
362 embedded_blob_code_size));
363 SLOW_DCHECK(memcmp(embedded_blob_code, embedded_blob_code_copy,
364 embedded_blob_code_size) == 0);
365 return embedded_blob_code_copy;
366 }
367
368 const size_t kAllocatePageSize = page_allocator()->AllocatePageSize();
369 const size_t kCommitPageSize = page_allocator()->CommitPageSize();
370 size_t allocate_code_size =
371 RoundUp(embedded_blob_code_size, kAllocatePageSize);
372
373 // Allocate the re-embedded code blob in such a way that it will be reachable
374 // by PC-relative addressing from biggest possible region.
375 const size_t max_pc_relative_code_range = kMaxPCRelativeCodeRangeInMB * MB;
376 size_t hint_offset =
377 std::min(max_pc_relative_code_range, code_region.size()) -
378 allocate_code_size;
379 void* hint = reinterpret_cast<void*>(code_region.begin() + hint_offset);
380
381 embedded_blob_code_copy =
382 reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(page_allocator()->AllocatePages(
383 hint, allocate_code_size, kAllocatePageSize,
384 PageAllocator::kNoAccessWillJitLater));
385
386 if (!embedded_blob_code_copy) {
387 V8::FatalProcessOutOfMemory(
388 isolate, "Can't allocate space for re-embedded builtins");
389 }
390 CHECK_EQ(embedded_blob_code_copy, hint);
391
392 if (code_region.size() > max_pc_relative_code_range) {
393 // The re-embedded code blob might not be reachable from the end part of
394 // the code range, so ensure that code pages will never be allocated in
395 // the "unreachable" area.
396 Address unreachable_start =
397 reinterpret_cast<Address>(embedded_blob_code_copy) +
398 max_pc_relative_code_range;
399
400 if (code_region.contains(unreachable_start)) {
401 size_t unreachable_size = code_region.end() - unreachable_start;
402
403 void* result = page_allocator()->AllocatePages(
404 reinterpret_cast<void*>(unreachable_start), unreachable_size,
405 kAllocatePageSize, PageAllocator::kNoAccess);
406 CHECK_EQ(reinterpret_cast<Address>(result), unreachable_start);
407 }
408 }
409
410 size_t code_size = RoundUp(embedded_blob_code_size, kCommitPageSize);
411 if constexpr (base::OS::IsRemapPageSupported()) {
412 // By default, the embedded builtins are not remapped, but copied. This
413 // costs memory, since builtins become private dirty anonymous memory,
414 // rather than shared, clean, file-backed memory for the embedded version.
415 // If the OS supports it, we can remap the builtins *on top* of the space
416 // allocated in the code range, making the "copy" shared, clean, file-backed
417 // memory, and thus saving sizeof(builtins).
418 //
419 // Builtins should start at a page boundary, see
420 // platform-embedded-file-writer-mac.cc. If it's not the case (e.g. if the
421 // embedded builtins are not coming from the binary), fall back to copying.
422 if (IsAligned(reinterpret_cast<uintptr_t>(embedded_blob_code),
423 kCommitPageSize)) {
424 bool ok = base::OS::RemapPages(embedded_blob_code, code_size,
425 embedded_blob_code_copy,
426 base::OS::MemoryPermission::kReadExecute);
427
428 if (ok) {
429 embedded_blob_code_copy_.store(embedded_blob_code_copy,
430 std::memory_order_release);
431 return embedded_blob_code_copy;
432 }
433 }
434 }
435
436 if (V8_HEAP_USE_PTHREAD_JIT_WRITE_PROTECT ||
437 V8_HEAP_USE_BECORE_JIT_WRITE_PROTECT || ThreadIsolation::Enabled()) {
438 if (!page_allocator()->RecommitPages(embedded_blob_code_copy, code_size,
439 PageAllocator::kReadWriteExecute)) {
440 V8::FatalProcessOutOfMemory(isolate,
441 "Re-embedded builtins: recommit pages");
442 }
443 RwxMemoryWriteScope rwx_write_scope(
444 "Enable write access to copy the blob code into the code range");
445 memcpy(embedded_blob_code_copy, embedded_blob_code,
446 embedded_blob_code_size);
447 } else {
448 if (!page_allocator()->SetPermissions(embedded_blob_code_copy, code_size,
449 PageAllocator::kReadWrite)) {
450 V8::FatalProcessOutOfMemory(isolate,
451 "Re-embedded builtins: set permissions");
452 }
453 memcpy(embedded_blob_code_copy, embedded_blob_code,
454 embedded_blob_code_size);
455
456 if (!page_allocator()->SetPermissions(embedded_blob_code_copy, code_size,
457 PageAllocator::kReadExecute)) {
458 V8::FatalProcessOutOfMemory(isolate,
459 "Re-embedded builtins: set permissions");
460 }
461 }
462 embedded_blob_code_copy_.store(embedded_blob_code_copy,
463 std::memory_order_release);
464 return embedded_blob_code_copy;
465}
466
467namespace {
468
469CodeRange* process_wide_code_range_ = nullptr;
470
471V8_DECLARE_ONCE(init_code_range_once);
472void InitProcessWideCodeRange(v8::PageAllocator* page_allocator,
473 size_t requested_size) {
474 CodeRange* code_range = new CodeRange();
475 if (!code_range->InitReservation(page_allocator, requested_size)) {
476 V8::FatalProcessOutOfMemory(
477 nullptr, "Failed to reserve virtual memory for CodeRange");
478 }
479 process_wide_code_range_ = code_range;
480#ifdef V8_EXTERNAL_CODE_SPACE
481#ifdef V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS_IN_SHARED_CAGE
482 ExternalCodeCompressionScheme::InitBase(
483 ExternalCodeCompressionScheme::PrepareCageBaseAddress(
484 code_range->base()));
485#endif // V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS_IN_SHARED_CAGE
486#endif // V8_EXTERNAL_CODE_SPACE
487}
488} // namespace
489
490// static
491CodeRange* CodeRange::EnsureProcessWideCodeRange(
492 v8::PageAllocator* page_allocator, size_t requested_size) {
493 base::CallOnce(&init_code_range_once, InitProcessWideCodeRange,
494 page_allocator, requested_size);
495 return process_wide_code_range_;
496}
497
498// static
499CodeRange* CodeRange::GetProcessWideCodeRange() {
500 return process_wide_code_range_;
501}

503} // namespace internal
504} // namespace v8
